    delete /actions/{id}

    Remove a action from PlanMill

    Secured by oauth_2.0

    PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

    • Request
    • Response

    URI Parameters

    • id: required (string)

    Headers

    • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

      See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

      nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

      timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

      signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

      Example:

      user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
    • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

      Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

      Example:

      EUR

    HTTP status code 204

    No HTTP body returned

    HTTP status code 400

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

    HTTP status code 401

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

    HTTP status code 403

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

    HTTP status code 404

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

    HTTP status code 429

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    HTTP status code 500

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

    /actions/{id}/meta get

    Get meta information for the updatable fields of the action

    get

    View details of single meta

    get /actions/{id}/meta

    View details of single meta

    Secured by oauth_2.0

    PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

    • Request
    • Response

    URI Parameters

    • id: required (string)

    Headers

    • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

      See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

      nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

      timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

      signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

      Example:

      user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
    • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

      Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

      Example:

      EUR

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "request": {
    "caption": "",
    "format": "int",
    "description": "",
    "values": null
  },
  "private": {
    "caption": "Private",
    "format": "short",
    "description": "",
    "enumeration": "Enumeration values.Sales management.Actions.View status",
    "values": {
      "No": "0",
      "Yes": "1"
    }
  },
  "performers": {
    "caption": "Performer(s)",
    "values": {
      "Admin, Test": "2833",
      "testi, testi": "2981"
    },
    "format": "string",
    "description": ""

  "reminder": {
    "caption": "Reminder",

      "14 days before due date": "5",

      "Call": "1",

    }

  "priority": {
    "caption": "Priority",
    "format": "short",
    "description": "",
    "enumeration": "Enumeration values.Sales management.Actions.Priority",
    "values": {
      "1. High": "1",
      "3. Low": "3",
      "2. Medium": "2"
    }
  },
  "salesOrder": {
    "caption": "",
    "format": "int",
    "description": "",
    "values": null
  },
  "responsible": {
    "caption": "Responsible person",
    "values": {
      "Admin, Test": 2833,
      "testi, testi": "2801981"
    },
    "format": "int",
    "description": ""
  },
  "contact": {
    "caption": "",
    "format": "int",
    "description": "",
    "values": null
  },
  "campaign": {
    "caption": "",
    "format": "int",
    "description": "",
    "values": null
  },
  "location": {
    "caption": "Location",

    "values": null

  "id": {
    "caption": "",
    "format": "int",
    "description": "",
    "values": null
  },
  "status": {
    "caption": "Status",
    "format": "short",
    "description": "",
    "enumeration": "Enumeration values.Sales management.Actions.Status",
    "values": {
      "3. In progress - waiting for more info": "2",
      "5. Completed": "40",
      "4. Suspended": "3",
      "1. Received": "0",
      "2. In progress": "1"
    }
  }
}

    HTTP status code 400

    Headers

    • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

    Headers

    Body

    Example:

  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

    Headers

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Example:

    {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

  "code": "00404"

    Body

    /actions/{id}/attachments get

    Collection of available attachments in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

    get

    Get a list of attachments

    get /actions/{id}/attachments

    Get a list of attachments

    Secured by oauth_2.0

    PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

    • Request
    • Response

    URI Parameters

    • id: required (string)

    Headers

    • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

      See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

      nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

      timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

      signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

      Example:

      user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
    • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

      Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

      Example:

      EUR

    Query Parameters

      HTTP status code 200

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      [
  {
    "size": 56,
    "createdBy": 2848153,
    "created": "2015-09-02T16:45:25.877+0300",
    "name": "attached_file.txt",
    "modified": "2015-09-02T16:45:23.353+0300",
    "id": 2848174
  },
  {
    "size": 56,
    "createdBy": 2848153,
    "created": "2015-09-02T16:45:25.877+0300",
    "name": "attached_file_delete.txt",
    "modified": "2015-09-02T16:45:23.353+0300",
    "id": 2848175
  }
]

      HTTP status code 400

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

      HTTP status code 401

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

      HTTP status code 403

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

      HTTP status code 404

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      /actions/{id}/attachments/{id} put get delete

      put
      get

      View details of single attachment

      delete

      Remove a attachment from PlanMill

      put /actions/{id}/attachments/{id}

      Secured by oauth_2.0

      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

      • Request
      • Response

      URI Parameters

      • id: required (string)
      • id: required (string)

      Headers

      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

        Example:

        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

        Example:

        EUR
      • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Example:

        application/json;charset=UTF-8

      No HTTP body returned

      get /actions/{id}/attachments/{id}

        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency.       delete /actions/{id}/attachments/{id}

      Remove a attachment from PlanMill

      Secured by oauth_2.0

      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

      • Request
      • Response

      URI Parameters

      • id: required (string)
      • id: required (string)

      Headers

      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

        Example:

        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

        Example:

        EUR

      Example:

  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

      /batch

      Submit multiple API requests as a batch operation. All available individual API requests are supported collected into a JSON array. Responses are also returned as an array in same order as posted. If any request fails, all subsequent requests fail. This is to support execution order inside the batch. All headers apply for all requests unless specific headers applied

      /batch post

      post

      post /batch

      Secured by oauth_2.0

      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

      • Request
      • Response

      Headers

      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

        Example:

        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

        Example:

        EUR
      • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Example:

        application/json;charset=UTF-8

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Schema:

      {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "batchEntity": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [ "destination", "method", "header" ],
      "properties": {
        "destination": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "API Resource-URI, that might have the ID included"
        },
        "method": {
          "enum": [ "POST", "DELETE", "GET" ],
          "description": "HTTP-method that defines the execution implementation"
        },
        "header": {
          "type": "object",
          "description": "JSON-Object includes all the individual header parameters needed for each request"
        },
        "body": {
          "oneOf": [
            {
              "type": "array",
              "items": {
                "type": "object"
              }
            },
            {
              "type": "object"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

      Example:

      [
  {
    "destination": "projects",
    "method": "POST",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      "name": "BatchDraftV1"
    }
  },
  {
    "destination": "projects/2839831",
    "method": "POST",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      "name": "BatchDraftV4"
    }
  },
  {
    "destination": "projects/2839830",
    "method": "DELETE",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      
    }
  }
]

      HTTP status code 200

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      [
  {
    "destination": "projects",
    "method": "POST",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      "name": "BatchDraftV1"
    }
  },
  {
    "destination": "projects/2839831",
    "method": "POST",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      "name": "BatchDraftV4"
    }
  },
  {
    "destination": "projects/2839830",
    "method": "DELETE",
    "header": {
      
    },
    "body": {
      
    }
  }
]

      HTTP status code 400

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

      HTTP status code 401

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

      HTTP status code 403

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

      HTTP status code 404

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

      HTTP status code 429

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      HTTP status code 500

      Headers

      • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

      Body

      Type: application/json

      Example:

      {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

      /boards

      Kanban board from PlanMill

      /boards get

      get

      Get a list of boards

      get /boards

      Get a list of boards

      Secured by oauth_2.0

      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

      • Request
      • Response

      Headers

      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

        Example:

        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

        Example:

        EUR

      Query Parameters

        HTTP status code 200

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Schema:

        {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all board entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/boardArray" }
    },
    {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/boardSingle"
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "boardSingle": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["name","id"],
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of the board"
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Id of the board"
        }
      }
    },
    "boardArray": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["name","id"],
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of the board"
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Id of the board"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

        Example:

        {
  "name": "New test board",
  "id": 1782
}

        HTTP status code 400

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

        HTTP status code 401

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

        HTTP status code 403

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

        HTTP status code 404

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

        HTTP status code 429

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        HTTP status code 500

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

        /boards/{id} get post delete

        A single board in PlanMill.

        get

        View details of single board. See boards/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

        post

        Update an existing resource board to PlanMill. See boards/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

        delete

        Remove a board from PlanMill

        get /boards/{id}

        View details of single board. See boards/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

        Secured by oauth_2.0

        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

        • Request
        • Response

        URI Parameters

        • id: required (string)

        Headers

        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

          Example:

          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

          Example:

          EUR

        HTTP status code 200

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "name": "New test board",
  "id": 1782
}

        HTTP status code 400

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

        HTTP status code 401

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

        HTTP status code 403

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

        HTTP status code 404

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

        HTTP status code 429

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        HTTP status code 500

        Headers

        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Example:

        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

        post /boards/{id}

        Update an existing resource board to PlanMill. See boards/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

        Secured by oauth_2.0

        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

        • Request
        • Response

        URI Parameters

        • id: required (string)

        Headers

        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

          Example:

          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

          Example:

          EUR
        • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Example:

          application/json;charset=UTF-8

        Body

        Type: application/json

        Schema:

        board

        Example:

        {
  "name": "New test board",
  "id": 1782
}

        HTTP status code 204

        No HTTP body returned

        delete /boards/{id}

        Remove a board from PlanMill

        Secured by oauth_2.0

        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

        • Request
        • Response

        URI Parameters

        • id: required (string)

        Headers

        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

          Example:

          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

          Example:

          EUR

        /boardlists

        Kanban boardlist from PlanMill

        /boardlists get

        get

        Get a list of boardlists

        get /boardlists

        Get a list of boardlists

        Secured by oauth_2.0

        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

        • Request
        • Response

        Headers

        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

          Example:

          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

          Example:

          EUR

        Query Parameters

          HTTP status code 200

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Schema:

          {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all board list entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/boardlistArray" }
    },
    {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/boardlistSingle"
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "boardlistSingle": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["board", "name"],
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of a board list"
        },
        "updatedFields": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": ""
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Id of the boardlist"
        },
        "resource": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Type of a resource"
        },
        "filters": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Filters of a resource"
        },
        "ordinalNumber": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": ""
        },
        "board": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "The board that the boardlist belongs to"
        }
      }
    },
    "boardlistArray": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["name", "board"],
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of a board list"
        },
        "updatedFields": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": ""
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Id of the board list"
        },
        "resource": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Type of a resource"
        },
        "filters": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Filters of a resource"
        },
        "ordinalNumber": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": ""
        },
        "board": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "The board that the board list belongs to"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

          Example:

          {
  "updatedFields": null,
  "ordinalNumber": 1,
  "resource": "projects",
  "name": "Test board list 1",
  "id": 1222,
  "filters": null,
  "board": 122
}

          HTTP status code 400

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

          HTTP status code 401

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

          HTTP status code 403

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

          HTTP status code 404

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

          HTTP status code 429

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          HTTP status code 500

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=

            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

          post /boardlists/{id}

          Update an existing resource boardlist to PlanMill. See boardlists/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

          Secured by oauth_2.0

          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

          • Request
          • Response

          URI Parameters

          • id: required (string)

          Headers

          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

            Example:

            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

            Example:

            EUR
          • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Example:

            application/json;charset=UTF-8

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Schema:

          boardlist

          Example:

          {
  "updatedFields": null,
  "ordinalNumber": 1,
  "resource": "projects",
  "name": "Test board list 1",
  "id": 1222,
  "filters": null,
  "board": 122
}

          HTTP status code 204

          No HTTP body returned

          HTTP status code 400

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

          HTTP status code 401

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

          HTTP status code 403

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

          HTTP status code 404

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

          HTTP status code 429

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          HTTP status code 500

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

          delete /boardlists/{id}

          Remove a boardlist from PlanMill

          Secured by oauth_2.0

          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

          • Request
          • Response

          URI Parameters

          • id: required (string)

          Headers

          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

            Example:

            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

            Example:

            EUR

          HTTP status code 204

          No HTTP body returned

          HTTP status code 400

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

          HTTP status code 401

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

          HTTP status code 403

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

          HTTP status code 404

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

          HTTP status code 429

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          HTTP status code 500

          Headers

          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

          Body

          Type: application/json

          Example:

          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"

          /capacitycalendars

          Collection of available capacitycalendars in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

          /capacitycalendars get

          get

          Get a list of capacitycalendars

          get /capacitycalendars

          Get a list of capacitycalendars

          Secured by oauth_2.0

          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

          • Request
          • Response

          Headers

          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

            Example:

            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

            Example:

            EUR

          Query Parameters

            HTTP status code 200

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Schema:

            {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all capacity calendars",
  "type": "array",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "country": {
      "type": ["integer", "null"],
      "description": "Id of a country in PlanMIll"
    },
    "defaultWeekStartDay": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Default week start date of a capacity calendar"
    },
    "defaultDailyWorkTime": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Total default working hours (in minutes) in a day"
    },
    "defaultDailyStartTime": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Default start time (in minutes) of daily work"
    },
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Name of a capacity calendar"
    },
    "start": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))",
      "description": "Start date of capacity calendar"
    },
    "defaultWeeklyWorkdays": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Default number of working days in a week"
    },
    "finish": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))",
      "description": "Finish date of capacity calendar"
    },
    "activeUsers": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Number of active users using this capacity calendar"
    },
    "id": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Internal ID of a capacity calendar"
    },
    "type": {
      "type": ["integer", "null"],
      "description": "Type of calendar"
    }
  }
}

            Example:

            [
  {
    "country": 73,
    "defaultWeekStartDay": 1,
    "defaultDailyWorktime": 510,
    "defaultDailyStartTime": 540,
    "name": "FI 2006 - 2010",
    "start": "2006-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "defaultWeeklyWorkdays": 5,
    "finish": "2011-12-31T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "activeUsers": 7,
    "id": 480895,
    "type": 0
  },
  {
    "country": null,
    "defaultWeekStartDay": 1,
    "defaultDailyWorktime": 450,
    "defaultDailyStartTime": 540,
    "name": "FI 2009 - 2019",
    "start": "2009-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "defaultWeeklyWorkdays": 5,
    "finish": "2019-12-31T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "activeUsers": 54,
    "id": 585281,
    "type": 0
  },
  {
    "country": 73,
    "defaultWeekStartDay": 1,
    "defaultDailyWorktime": 360,
    "defaultDailyStartTime": 540,
    "name": "FI2011: Osa-aika - 30 h/vk",
    "start": "2011-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "defaultWeeklyWorkdays": 5,
    "finish": "2011-12-31T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "activeUsers": 1,
    "id": 2771516,
    "type": 2
  }
]

            HTTP status code 400

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

            HTTP status code 401

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

            HTTP status code 403

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

            HTTP status code 404

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

            HTTP status code 429

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            HTTP status code 500

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"

            /capacitycalendars/meta get

            Get meta information for capacity calendars. Includes resource's fields names and type and related filters

            get

            View details of single meta

            get /capacitycalendars/meta

            View details of single meta

            Secured by oauth_2.0

            PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

            • Request
            • Response

            Headers

            • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

              See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

              nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

              timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

              signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

              Example:

              user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
            • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

              Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

              Example:

              EUR

            HTTP status code 200

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "filters": [
    {
      "name": "rowcount",
      "caption": "Rows",
      "values": {
        "25": "25",
        "50": "50",
        "75": "75",
        "100": "100",
        "150": "150",
        "250": "250"
      }
    }
  ],
  "fields": {
    "country": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Location.CountryId",
      "caption": "Country"
    },
    "defaultWeekStartDay": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Administration.Calendars.Days",
      "caption": "Default week start day"
    },
    "defaultDailyWorktime": {
      "format": "hour",
      "caption": "Default work time daily"
    },
    "defaultDailyStartTime": {
      "format": "time",
      "caption": "Default start time daily"
    },
    "name": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "_Name"
    },
    "start": {
      "format": "shortdate",
      "caption": "Start"
    },
    "defaultWeeklyWorkdays": {
      "format": "number",
      "caption": "Default work days weekly"
    },
    "finish": {
      "format": "shortdate",
      "caption": "Finish"
    },
    "activeUsers": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "Active users"
    },
    "id": {
      "format": "checkbox",
      "caption": "_"
    },
    "type": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Employee directory.Contact.Employee status",
      "caption": "Type"
    }
  }
}

            HTTP status code 400

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"

            /capacitycalendars/{id}/capacity/{date}

            Set a single day's capacity for a capacity calendar

            /capacitycalendars/{id}/capacity/{date} put

            put

            put /capacitycalendars/{id}/capacity/{date}

            Secured by oauth_2.0

            PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

            • Request
            • Response

            URI Parameters

            • date: required (date)

              Capacity date in UTC format

              Example:

              2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
            • id: required (string)

            Headers

            • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

              See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

              nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

              timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

              signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

              Example:

              user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
            • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

              Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

              Example:

              EUR
            • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

              Example:

              application/json;charset=UTF-8

            Body

            Type: application/json

            HTTP status code 204

            No HTTP body returned

            HTTP status code 400

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

            HTTP status code 401

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

            HTTP status code 403

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Type: application/json

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

            Headers

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            Example:

            {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"

            • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

            Body

            /contacts

            Collection of available contacts in PlanMill. See contacts/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

            /contacts get post

            get

            Get a list of contacts. See contacts/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

            post

            Add a new contact to PlanMill or update existing (if id is given). See contacts/meta for list of columns and formats

            get /contacts

            Get a list of contacts. See contacts/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

            Secured by oauth_2.0

            PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

            • Request
            • Response

            Headers

            • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

              See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

              nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

              timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

              signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

              Example:

              user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
            • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

              Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

              Example:

              EUR

            Query Parameters

              HTTP status code 200

              Body

              Type: application/json

              Schema:

              {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all contacts entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/contactArray" }
    },
    {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/contactSingle"
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "contactSingle": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [ "lastName", "account", "passive" ],
      "properties": {
        "firstName": {
          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 80,
          "description": "First name of a contact"
        },
        "lastName": {
          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 80,
          "description": "Last name of a contact "
        },
        "passive": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Contact status can be active or passive. 0=Active 1=InActive"
        },
        "account": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Id of contact's account"
        },
        "languageCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Language code"
        },
        "role": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Basic Roles: 1=Administrator, 2=Power, 3=Pro, 4=Team, 5=Sales"
        },
        "title": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Title of contact"
        },
        "email": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Email address of contact"
        },
        "secondaryAddress": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary address of contact"
        },
        "primaryState": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Primary state of contact"
        },
        "secondaryEmail": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary email of contact"
        },
        "primaryPostalCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Primary postal code of contact"
        },
        "accountName": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Account name of contact"
        },
        "secondaryDepartment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary Department name of contact"
        },
        "blog": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's blog"
        },
        "primaryCity": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's city"
        },
        "secondaryPostalCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary postal code"
        },
        "skype": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's skype name"
        },
        "twitter": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's twitter account name"
        },
        "primaryDepartment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary department"
        },
        "secondaryCity": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary city"
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Contact's id"
        },
        "department": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's department"
        },
        "fax": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's fax"
        },
        "primaryCountry": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary country"
        },
        "secondaryCountry": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary country"
        },
        "facebook": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's facebook address"
        },
        "linkedIn": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's linkedIn address"
        },
        "projectWikiUserGroup": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's projectWikiUserGroup"
        },
        "mobilePhone": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's mobile phone number"
        },
        "workPhone": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's work phone number"
        },
        "googleTalk": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's google talk address"
        },
        "primaryAddress": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary address"
        }
      }
    },
    "contactArray": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "lastName",
        "account",
        "passive"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "firstName": {
          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 80,
          "description": "First name of a contact"
        },
        "lastName": {
          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 80,
          "description": "Last name of a contact "
        },
        "passive": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Contact status can be active or passive. 0=Active 1=InActive"
        },
        "account": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Id of contact's account"
        },
        "languageCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Language code"
        },
        "role": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Basic Roles: 1=Administrator, 2=Power, 3=Pro, 4=Team, 5=Sales"
        },
        "title": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Title of contact"
        },
        "email": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Email address of contact"
        },
        "secondaryAddress": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary address of contact"
        },
        "primaryState": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Primary state of contact"
        },
        "secondaryEmail": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary email of contact"
        },
        "primaryPostalCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Primary postal code of contact"
        },
        "accountName": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Account name of contact"
        },
        "secondaryDepartment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Secondary Department name of contact"
        },
        "blog": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's blog"
        },
        "primaryCity": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's city"
        },
        "secondaryPostalCode": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary postal code"
        },
        "skype": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's skype name"
        },
        "twitter": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's twitter account name"
        },
        "primaryDepartment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary department"
        },
        "secondaryCity": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary city"
        },
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Contact's id"
        },
        "department": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's department"
        },
        "fax": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's fax"
        },
        "primaryCountry": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary country"
        },
        "secondaryCountry": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's secondary country"
        },
        "facebook": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's facebook address"
        },
        "linkedIn": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's linkedIn address"
        },
        "projectWikiUserGroup": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's projectWikiUserGroup"
        },
        "mobilePhone": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's mobile phone number"
        },
        "workPhone": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's work phone number"
        },
        "googleTalk": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's google talk address"
        },
        "primaryAddress": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Contact's primary address"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

              Example:

              [
  {
    "lastName": "Tester, First",
    "secondaryAddress": Kuitinkatu 2,
    "primaryPostalCode": 00500,

    "primaryCity": Helsinki,
    "invoiceXsl": bull,
    "secondaryPostalCode": 02210,

    "modifiedBy": "Tester, Second",
    "id": 3574,
