                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                              HTTP status code 403

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                              HTTP status code 404

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                              HTTP status code 429

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              HTTP status code 500

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                              /projects/{id}/purchases/id get post delete

                                              Single purchase information for a project

                                              get

                                              View details of single id. See ids/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                              post

                                              Update an existing resource id to PlanMill. See ids/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                              delete

                                              Remove a id from PlanMill

                                              get /projects/{id}/purchases/id

                                              View details of single id. See ids/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                              Secured by oauth_2.0

                                              PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                              • Request
                                              • Response

                                              URI Parameters

                                              • id: required (string)

                                              Headers

                                              • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                Example:

                                                user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                              • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                Example:

                                                EUR

                                              HTTP status code 200

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
    "date": "2016-01-18T12:23:00.000+0200",
    "accountName": null,
    "actualAmount": 50,
    "description": null,
    "project": 4751,
    "billableStatus": 1,
    "type": 7,
    "personName": null,
    "task": 4751,
    "contact": null,
    "name": "View Purchases",
    "plannedAmount": 100,
    "id": 4764,
    "account": null,
    "status": 0
}

                                              HTTP status code 400

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                              HTTP status code 401

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                              HTTP status code 403

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                              HTTP status code 404

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                              HTTP status code 429

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              HTTP status code 500

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                              post /projects/{id}/purchases/id

                                              Update an existing resource id to PlanMill. See ids/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                              Secured by oauth_2.0

                                              PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                              • Request
                                              • Response

                                              URI Parameters

                                              • id: required (string)

                                              Headers

                                              • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                Example:

                                                user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                              • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                Example:

                                                EUR
                                              • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Example:

                                                application/json;charset=UTF-8

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Schema:

                                              id

                                              Example:

                                              {
    "date": "2016-01-18T12:23:00.000+0200",
    "accountName": null,
    "actualAmount": 50,
    "description": null,
    "project": 4751,
    "billableStatus": 1,
    "type": 7,
    "personName": null,
    "task": 4751,
    "contact": null,
    "name": "View Purchases",
    "plannedAmount": 100,
    "id": 4764,
    "account": null,
    "status": 0
}

                                              HTTP status code 204

                                              No HTTP body returned

                                              HTTP status code 400

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                              HTTP status code 401

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                              HTTP status code 403

                                              Headers

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"

                                              Type: application/json

  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"

                                              • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              delete /projects/{id}/purchases/id

                                              Remove a id from PlanMill

                                              Secured by oauth_2.0

                                              PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                              • Request
                                              • Response

                                              URI Parameters

                                              • id: required (string)

                                              Headers

                                              • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                Example:

                                                user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                              • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                Example:

                                                EUR

                                              No HTTP body returned

                                              /projects/{id}/purchases/id/meta get

                                              Get meta information for the purchase of a project

                                              get

                                              View details of single meta

                                              get /projects/{id}/purchases/id/meta

                                              View details of single meta

                                              Secured by oauth_2.0

                                              PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                              • Request
                                              • Response

                                              URI Parameters

                                              • id: required (string)

                                              Headers

                                              • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                Example:

                                                user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                              • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                Example:

                                                EUR

                                              HTTP status code 200

                                              Body

                                              Type: application/json

                                              Example:

                                              {
    "date": {
        "calendar": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ",
        "caption": "Date",
        "maxlength": "10",
        "values": null
    },
    "accountName": {
        "caption": "Account",
        "format": "string",
        "description": "",
        "values": null
    },
    "actualAmount": {
        "caption": "Actual cost",
        "format": "double",
        "values": null
    },
    "description": {
        "caption": "",
        "format": "string",
        "values": null
    },
    "project": {
        "caption": "",
        "format": "int",
        "values": null
    },
    "billableStatus": {
        "caption": "Billable status",

        "values": {
            "In billing": "4",
            "Billable": "1",
            "Non-billable": "3"
        }
    },
    "type": {
        "caption": "Type",

        "values": {
            "Travel": "0",
            "Software": "5",
            "Hardware": "6",
            "Books": "4",
            "Other": "7"
        }
    },
    "personName": {
        "caption": "Contact",
        "format": "string",
        "description": "",
        "values": null

    "task": {
        "caption": "Task",

        "values": null

    "contact": {
        "values": null

    "name": {
        "caption": "Name",
        "maxlength": "255",
        "values": null

        "caption": "Planned cost",
        "format": "double",
        "values": null

    "id": {
        "values": null
    },
    "account": {
        "values": null
    },
    "status": {
        "caption": "Status",
        "enumeration": "Enumeration values.Expense.Status dates",
        "values": {
            "Locked": "9",
            "Preliminary": "0",
            "Reported": "2",
            "Paid": "6",
            "Rejected": "7",
            "Inspected": "3",
            "Accepted": "4"
        }
    }
}

                                              /projects/{id}/purchases/meta get

                                              Get meta information for the purchase of a project

                                              get

                                              Get a list of meta

                                              get /projects/{id}/purchases/meta

                                              Get a list of meta

                                              Secured by oauth_2.0

                                              PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                              • Request
                                              • Response

                                              URI Parameters

                                              • id: required (string)

                                              Headers

                                              • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                Example:

                                                user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                              • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                Example:

                                                EUR

                                              Query Parameters

                                                HTTP status code 200

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
    "filters": [
        {
            "name": "freetextsearch",
            "caption": ""
        },
        {
            "name": "status",
            "caption": "Purchase status",
            "values": {
                "0": "Preliminary",
                "2": "Reported",
                "3": "Inspected",
                "-1": "All",
                "4": "Accepted",
                "6": "Paid",
                "7": "Rejected",
                "9": "Locked"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": "billableStatus",
            "caption": "Billable status",
            "values": {
                "1": "Billable",
                "3": "Non-billable",
                "-1": "All",
                "4": "In billing",
                "5": "Draft invoice",
                "6": "Invoiced"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": "period",
            "caption": "Period",
            "values": {
                "22": "This & last FQ",
                "44": "Today and tomorrow",
                "23": "This and last FY",
                "24": "This and next month",
                "25": "This and last month",
                "26": "Last 14 days",
                "30": "This week",
                "31": "Last week",
                "10": "Next month",
                "32": "This and last week",
                "11": "Last month",
                "33": "Next week",
                "34": "This and next week",
                "12": "Last 30 days",
                "13": "Last 60 days",
                "14": "Last 90 days",
                "15": "Last 120 days",
                "16": "Last 180 days",
                "17": "Next 30 days",
                "18": "Next 60 days",
                "19": "Next 90 days",
                "0": "All",
                "1": "This FQ",
                "2": "Next FQ",
                "3": "This and next FQ",
                "4": "Last FQ",
                "5": "This FY",
                "6": "Next FY",
                "7": "This and next FY",
                "8": "Last FY",
                "9": "This month",
                "40": "Today",
                "41": "Yesterday",
                "42": "Today and yesterday",
                "20": "Next 120 days",
                "43": "Tomorrow",
                "21": "Next 180 days"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": "interval",
            "calendar": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ",
            "values": {
                "Expense.Created": "Created",
                "Expense.Date": "Date",
                "Expense.Modified": "Modified"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": "rowcount",
            "caption": "Rows",
            "values": {
                "100": "100",
                "25": "25",
                "50": "50",
                "150": "150",
                "250": "250",
                "75": "75"
            }
        }
    ],
    "fields": {
        "date": {
            "format": "shortdate",
            "caption": "Date"
        },
        "actualAmount": {
            "format": "projectcurrency",
            "caption": "Actual"
        },
        "description": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Description"
        },
        "type": {
            "format": "Enumeration values.Purchase.Type",
            "caption": "Type"
        },
        "billableStatus": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Billable status"
        },
        "task": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": null
        },
        "createdBy": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Person1.Id"
        },
        "name": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Name"
        },
        "modifiedBy": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Person2.Id"
        },
        "id": {
            "format": "checkbox",
            "caption": ""
        },
        "plannedAmount": {
            "format": "projectcurrency",
            "caption": "Planned"
        },
        "account": {
            "format": "text",
            "caption": "Account.Id"
        },
        "status": {
            "format": "Enumeration values.Expense.Status",
            "caption": "Status"
        }
    }
}

                                                HTTP status code 400

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                HTTP status code 401

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                HTTP status code 403

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                HTTP status code 404

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                HTTP status code 429

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                HTTP status code 500

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                /projects/{id}/tasks get

                                                Please note that this data model might change and might be inconsistent with the schema right now

                                                get

                                                Get a list of tasks

                                                get /projects/{id}/tasks

                                                Get a list of tasks

                                                Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                • Request
                                                • Response

                                                URI Parameters

                                                • id: required (string)

                                                Headers

                                                • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                  See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                  nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                  timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                  signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                  Example:

                                                  user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                  Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                  Example:

                                                  EUR

                                                Query Parameters

                                                • rowcount: (integer - minimum: 1)

                                                  It limits the result set amount to the specified limit to avoid API call to return too many records. Default row count is 100

                                                • nextrows: (integer)

                                                  The number of the next starting row. It is dependent on rowcount. For example, for total 250 items, if rowcount is 100 and nextrows is 101, it return items 101-201

                                                • order: (integer)

                                                  Orders the results in ascending or descending order. 0=Ascending and 1=Descending. It is used in combination with sort

                                                • sort: (integer)

                                                  Sorts the results using number that is associated with each column

                                                • interval: (string)

                                                  Interval type, e.g. start, finish, created, or modified. It is used in combination with intervalstart or intervalfinish

                                                • intervalstart: (string)

                                                  Start date of the interval in UTC format

                                                  Example:

                                                  2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
                                                • intervalfinish: (string)

                                                  Finish date of the interval in UTC format

                                                  Example:

                                                  2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200

                                                HTTP status code 200

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Schema:

                                                {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all task entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/task" }
    },
    {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/task"
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "task": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["name", "type", "start", "finish", "dutyType", "billableStatus"],
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 255,
          "description": "Name of a task"
        },
        "type": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Type of the task"
        },
        "project": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Project of a task"
        },
        "start": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])",
          "description": "Start date of a task in yyyy-MM-dd format"
        },
        "finish": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])",
          "description": "Finish date of a task in yyyy-MM-dd format"
        },
        "dutyType": {
          "type": [ "integer", "null" ],
          "description": "Enumeration of duty type of task"
        },
        "billableStatus": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Enumeration of a task's billable status: 1=Fixed, 2=Time-based , 3=Non-billable."
        },
        "parent": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Parent of a task"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

                                                Example:

                                                [
  {
    "totalEffort": 0,
    "status": "",
    "workCompleteness": 0,
    "unitPrice": null,
    "type": 1,
    "modified": "2012-05-02T14:57:24.873+0300",
    "id": 584063,
    "finish": "2009-12-31T16:30:00.000+0200",
    "duration": 49050,
    "remainingEffort": 0,
    "wbs": "",
    "plannedEffort": 0,
    "created": "2009-09-16T13:16:15.373+0300",
    "start": "2009-08-03T09:00:00.000+0300",
    "actualEffort": 0,
    "dutyType": 0,
    "name": "Test Task 1",
    "totalRemainingEffort": null,
    "billableStatus": 2,
    "targetEffort": 120
  },
  {
    "totalEffort": 0,
    "status": "3. In progress",
    "workCompleteness": 0,
    "unitPrice": null,
    "type": 100,
    "modified": "2011-03-18T14:18:38.060+0200",
    "id": 584080,
    "finish": "2009-12-31T16:30:00.000+0200",
    "duration": 49050,
    "remainingEffort": 0,
    "wbs": "",
    "plannedEffort": 0,
    "created": "2009-09-16T13:56:48.650+0300",
    "start": "2009-08-03T09:00:00.000+0300",
    "actualEffort": 0,
    "dutyType": 0,
    "name": "test Task 2",
    "totalRemainingEffort": null,
    "billableStatus": 2,
    "targetEffort": 120
  }
]

                                                HTTP status code 400

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                HTTP status code 401

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                HTTP status code 403

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                HTTP status code 404

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                HTTP status code 429

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                HTTP status code 500

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                /projects/{id}/tasks/meta get

                                                Get meta information for tasks. Includes resource's fields names and type and related filters

                                                get

                                                View details of single meta

                                                get /projects/{id}/tasks/meta

                                                View details of single meta

                                                Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                • Request
                                                • Response

                                                URI Parameters

                                                • id: required (string)

                                                Headers

                                                • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                  See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                  nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                  timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                  signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                  Example:

                                                  user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                  Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                  Example:

                                                  EUR

                                                HTTP status code 200

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "filters": [
    {
      "name": "searchkey",
      "caption": ""
    },
    {
      "name": "viewby",
      "caption": "View by",
      "values": {
        "All recently created tasks - this month": "20",
        "My tasks": "10",
        "All tasks": "0",
        "All recently completed tasks - this month": "40",
        "All not completed milestones": "150",
        "All completed tasks & requests": "100",
        "All not completed requests": "140",
        "All recently created tasks - last month": "30",
        "All not completed tasks": "130",
        "All not completed tasks & requests": "120",
        "All recently completed tasks - last month": "50",
        "All tasks in progress - late": "6",
        "All completed requests": "110"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "viewby2",
      "caption": "Type",
      "values": {
        "All": "0",
        "Tasks & milestones": "25",
        "Tasks": "10",
        "Milestones": "20",
        "Requests": "30"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "status",
      "caption": "Status",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "billableStatus",
      "caption": "Billing type",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1",
        "Non-billable": "3",
        "Time based": "2",
        "Fixed": "1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Assignment.PersonId",
      "caption": "Performer",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Team.Id",
      "caption": "Team",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "parent",
      "caption": "Parent",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Baseline.Id",
      "caption": "Baseline",
      "values": {
        "-": "-1"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "interval",
      "calendar": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ",
      "values": {
        "Modified": "modified",
        "Start": "start",
        "Finish": "finish",
        "Created": "created"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "CreatedPerson.Id",
      "caption": "Created by",
      "values": {
        "All": "-1",
        "Mikkonen, Aalto": "2734",
        "PlanMill, Admin": "1000"
      }
    }
  ],
  "fields": {
    "unitPrice": {
      "format": "projectcurrency",
      "caption": "Unit price"
    },
    "dutyType": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Task.Offduty",
      "caption": "Duty type"
    },
    "targetEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Estimated"
    },
    "plannedEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Planned"
    },
    "created": {
      "format": "mediumdate",
      "caption": "Created"
    },
    "start": {
      "format": "shortdate",
      "caption": "Start"
    },
    "wbs": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "WBS"
    },
    "remainingEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Remain"
    },
    "totalEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Forecast"
    },
    "totalRemainingEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Total remain"
    },
    "type": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Task.Type",
      "caption": "Type"
    },
    "billableStatus": {
      "format": "Enumeration values.Project.Billable status",
      "caption": "Billing type"
    },
    "duration": {
      "format": "day",
      "caption": "Duration"
    },
    "actualEffort": {
      "format": "projecteffortunit",
      "caption": "Accepted"
    },
    "name": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "_Task"
    },
    "modified": {
      "format": "mediumdate",
      "caption": "Modified"
    },
    "finish": {
      "format": "shortdate",
      "caption": "Finish"
    },
    "id": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "Task.Id"
    },
    "workCompleteness": {
      "format": "percent",
      "caption": "Completeness"
    },
    "status": {
      "format": "text",
      "caption": "Status"
    }
  }
}

                                                HTTP status code 400

                                                Headers

                                                • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                Type: application/json

  "code": "00401"

                                                Body

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

  "code": "00403"

                                                Type: application/json

                                                Example:

                                                {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"

                                                Body

                                                /projects/{id}/requests get

                                                List requests information for a project

                                                get

                                                Get a list of requests

                                                get /projects/{id}/requests

                                                Get a list of requests

                                                Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                • Request
                                                • Response

                                                URI Parameters

                                                • id: required (string)

                                                Headers

                                                • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                  See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                  nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                  timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                  signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                  Example:

                                                  user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                  Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                  Example:

                                                  EUR

                                                Query Parameters

                                                  HTTP status code 200

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  [
  {
    "taskBillableStatus": 3,
    "targetEffort": 0,
    "accountName": "PlanMill Oy",
    "offDuty": 0,
    "origin": 4,
    "project": 1436,
    "type": 2,
    "requestId": 1446,
    "actualEffort": 0,
    "responsible": null,
    "reported": 0,
    "modifiedBy": null,
    "id": 1445,
    "deadline": "2016-01-12T12:34:00.000+0200",
    "unitPrice": null,
    "plannedEffort": 360,
    "purchases": 0,
    "created": "2016-01-11T12:34:19.443+0200",
    "contactName": "Project.LastName, Project.FirstName",
    "start": "2016-01-11T12:34:00.000+0200",
    "emailsAmount": 0,
    "remainingEffort": 360,
    "totalEffort": 360,
    "priority": 0,
    "task": 1447,
    "createdBy": 1415,
    "name": "InsertRequest",
    "projectName": "DBUNIT_Project (1439)",
    "status": 0,
    "expenses": 0
  }
]

                                                  HTTP status code 400

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 401

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 403

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 404

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 429

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  HTTP status code 500

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                  /projects/{id}/requests/meta get

                                                  Get meta information for the request of a project

                                                  get

                                                  View details of single meta

                                                  get /projects/{id}/requests/meta

                                                  View details of single meta

                                                  Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                  PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                  • Request
                                                  • Response

                                                  URI Parameters

                                                  • id: required (string)

                                                  Headers

                                                  • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                    See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                    nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                    timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                    signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                    Example:

                                                    user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                  • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                    Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                    Example:

                                                    EUR

                                                  HTTP status code 200

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
    "filters": [
        {
            "name": "searchkey",
            "caption": ""
        },
        {
            "name": "viewby",
            "caption": "View by",
            "values": {
                "22": "All open requests - late more than 7 days",
                "23": "All open requests - late more than 14 days",
                "26": "All recently closed requests - this week",

                "10": "My recently closed requests - last week",
                "32": "My inactive requests",

    "fields": null
}

                                                  HTTP status code 400

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 404

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                  HTTP status code 429

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  HTTP status code 500

                                                  Headers

                                                  • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                  /reports

                                                  Collection of available reports in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

                                                  /reports get

                                                  get

                                                  Get a list of reports

                                                  get /reports

                                                  Get a list of reports

                                                  Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                  PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                  • Request
                                                  • Response

                                                  Headers

                                                  • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                    See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                    nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                    timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                    signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                    Example:

                                                    user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                  • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                    Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                    Example:

                                                    EUR

                                                  Query Parameters

                                                  • rowcount: (integer - minimum: 1)

                                                    It limits the result set amount to the specified limit to avoid API call to return too many records. Default row count is 100

                                                  • nextrows: (integer)

                                                    The number of the next starting row. It is dependent on rowcount. For example, for total 250 items, if rowcount is 100 and nextrows is 101, it return items 101-201

                                                  • order: (integer)

                                                    Orders the results in ascending or descending order. 0=Ascending and 1=Descending. It is used in combination with sort

                                                  • sort: (integer)

                                                    Sorts the results using number that is associated with each column

                                                  • modernOnly: (boolean)

                                                    Only list reports which can be viewed by the report API

                                                  • exportType: (one of level1, level2, detailed)

                                                    Export type which can be used to only export top 1 or 2 categories of a report. (Only applies when exporting to pdf, xsl, csv or xml); level1 exports only top level categories; level2 exports only top 2 categories; detailed (default when parameter not set) export all rows

                                                  HTTP status code 200

                                                  Body

                                                  Type: application/json

                                                  Example:

                                                  {
  "Project homepage": [
    {
      "reports": [
        {
          "localizedName": "Time and expense reports by month",
          "modern": false,
          "hasAccess": true,
          "name": "Time and expense reports by month",
          "favorite": true
