                                                                    delete /teams/{id}/attachments/{id}

                                                                    Remove a attachment from PlanMill

                                                                    Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                    PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                    • Request
                                                                    • Response

                                                                    URI Parameters

                                                                    • id: required (string)
                                                                    • id: required (string)

                                                                    Headers

                                                                    • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                      See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                      nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                      timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                      signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                      Example:

                                                                      user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                    • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                      Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                      Example:

                                                                      EUR

                                                                    /teams/{id}/members get

                                                                    Collection of available members in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

                                                                    get

                                                                    Get a list of members

                                                                    get /teams/{id}/members

                                                                    Get a list of members

                                                                    Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                    PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                    • Request
                                                                    • Response

                                                                    URI Parameters

                                                                    • id: required (string)

                                                                    Headers

                                                                    • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                      See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                      nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                      timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                      signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                      Example:

                                                                      user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                    • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                      Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                      Example:

                                                                      EUR

                                                                    Query Parameters

                                                                      HTTP status code 200

                                                                      Body

                                                                      Type: application/json

                                                                      Example:

                                                                      [
  {
    "lastName": "Last Name",
    "firstName": "First Name",
    "added": "2015-08-18T12:43:46.817+0300",
    "person": 2853944,
    "addedBy": 2853944,
    "primaryTeam": 1
  },
  {
    "lastName": "User",
    "firstName": "Person",
    "added": "2015-08-18T12:43:46.817+0300",
    "person": 2853944,
    "addedBy": 2853944,
    "primaryTeam": 1
  }
]

                                                                      A single team member in PlanMill

                                                                      put
                                                                      delete

                                                                      Remove a member from PlanMill

                                                                      put /teams/{id}/members/{id}

                                                                      Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                      • Request
                                                                      • Response

                                                                      URI Parameters

                                                                      • id: required (string)
                                                                      • id: required (string)

                                                                      Headers

                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        EUR

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        true | false

                                                                      delete /teams/{id}/members/{id}

                                                                      Remove a member from PlanMill

                                                                      Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                      • Request
                                                                      • Response

                                                                      URI Parameters

                                                                      • id: required (string)
                                                                      • id: required (string)

                                                                      Headers

                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                        EUR

                                                                      /teams/{id}/unitcosts get

                                                                      List of team member unit costs in PlanMill

                                                                      get

                                                                      Get a list of unitcosts

                                                                      get /teams/{id}/unitcosts

                                                                      Get a list of unitcosts

                                                                      Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                      PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                      • Request
                                                                      • Response

                                                                      URI Parameters

                                                                      • id: required (string)

                                                                      Headers

                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                        See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                        nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                        timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                        signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                      • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                        Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        EUR

                                                                      Query Parameters

                                                                        HTTP status code 200

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Schema:

                                                                        {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all team unit cost entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/teamUnitCostArray" }
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "teamUnitCostArray": {
    "type": "object",
	  "required": "",
	  "additionalProperties": true,
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Internal ID of the user unit cost"
        },
        "amount": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Amount of the user unit cost"
        },
        "unit": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Enumeration type for the unit value; 2=h, 4=days, 10=wk, 5=mth"
        },
        "validUntil": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))",
          "description": "End date for the unit cost"
        },
        "validFrom": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))",
          "description": "Start date for the unit cost"
        },
        "type": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Enumeration type for the unit cost. 1=External price, 2=Internal total cost, 3=Internal self cost"
        },
      }
    }
  }
}

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        [
  {
    "amount": 1111,
    "unit": 2,
    "validUntil": null,
    "comment": "",
    "id": 10808,
    "validFrom": null,
    "type": 1
  }
]

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        /tempfiles

                                                                        /tempfiles post

                                                                        post

                                                                        Add a new tempfile to PlanMill

                                                                        post /tempfiles

                                                                        Add a new tempfile to PlanMill

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR
                                                                        • Content-Type: required (string - default: multipart/form-data )

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          multipart/form-data

                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                        • name: (string)

                                                                          Name of uploaded file

                                                                        • description: (string)

                                                                          Description of uploaded file

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: multipart/form-data

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        Contents of file

                                                                        HTTP status code 201

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        { "id" : 123456 }

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        /tempfiles/{id} get delete

                                                                        get

                                                                        View details of single tempfile

                                                                        delete

                                                                        Remove a tempfile from PlanMill

                                                                        get /tempfiles/{id}

                                                                        View details of single tempfile

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        URI Parameters

                                                                        • id: required (string)

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR

                                                                        HTTP status code 200

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        Contents of file

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        delete /tempfiles/{id}

                                                                        Remove a tempfile from PlanMill

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        URI Parameters

                                                                        • id: required (string)

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR

                                                                        HTTP status code 204

                                                                        No HTTP body returned

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        /timereports

                                                                        Collection of available timereports in PlanMill. See timereports/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                                                        /timereports get post

                                                                        get

                                                                        Get a list of timereports. See timereports/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                                                        post

                                                                        Add a new timereport to PlanMill or update existing (if id is given). See timereports/meta for list of columns and formats

                                                                        get /timereports

                                                                        Get a list of timereports. See timereports/meta for list of filters, columns and formats

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR

                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                        • rowcount: (integer - minimum: 1)

                                                                          It limits the result set amount to the specified limit to avoid API call to return too many records. Default row count is 100

                                                                        • nextrows: (integer)

                                                                          The number of the next starting row. It is dependent on rowcount. For example, for total 250 items, if rowcount is 100 and nextrows is 101, it return items 101-201

                                                                        • order: (integer)

                                                                          Orders the results in ascending or descending order. 0=Ascending and 1=Descending. It is used in combination with sort

                                                                        • sort: (string)

                                                                          Sorts the results using string that is a JSON attribute

                                                                        • interval: (string)

                                                                          Interval type, e.g. start, finish, created, or modified. It is used in combination with intervalstart or intervalfinish

                                                                        • intervalstart: (string)

                                                                          Start date of the interval in UTC format, intervalfinish required

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          22014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
                                                                        • intervalfinish: (string)

                                                                          Finish date of the interval in UTC format, intervalstart required

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
                                                                        • period: (integer)

                                                                          Period like This year, this month etc. See values from /meta endpoint.

                                                                        • status: (integer)

                                                                          Used in enumeration of status

                                                                        • billableStatus: (integer)

                                                                          Used in enumeration of billableStatus

                                                                        • projectfilter: (integer)

                                                                          Id of a project. It could be used for querying multiple projects' time reports by comma-separated id, e.g., "projectfilter=projectid_1,projectid_2"

                                                                        • person: (integer)

                                                                          Id of a person. Required, but if not given in request, authenticated API user's time reports are returned. For performance reasons time reports of all users can not be returned

                                                                        HTTP status code 200

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Schema:

                                                                        {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all timereport entities",
  "oneOf": [
    {
      "type": "array",
      "items": { "$ref": "#/definitions/timereport" }
    },
    {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/timereport"
    }
  ],
  "definitions": {
    "timereport": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["start"],
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "required": ["amount"]
        },
        {
          "required": ["finish"]
        }
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Internal ID of a time report"
        },
        "start": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))",
          "description": "only date part is used for saving time report unless clock times -mode is active in users role"
        },
        "finish": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
        },
        "amount": {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "Reported time in hours using decimals. 15 min = 0,25 hours"
        },
        "billableStatus": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "If task's status is billable, time report's status can be either billable or non-billable"
        },
        "billableAmount": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Billable amount of time report can be given separately, if reported amount affecting person's balance is different"
        },
        "billingComment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Billing comment of a time report"
        },
        "comment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Comments of a time report"
        },
        "dutyType": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Type of duty"
        },
        "overtimeAmount": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Time in minutes for amount of overtime work done"
        },
        "overtimeComment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Comment for overtime work"
        },
        "project": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Id of project having task to report the time"
        },
        "remainingAmount": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Remaining amount of a time report"
        },
        "requireBillableComment": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Used in get requests to indicate if task requires a comment for timereport"
        },
        "status": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Status of a time report"
        },
        "person": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "User's id"
        },
        "task": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Id of task for which time is reported"
        },
        "totalReported": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Total reported time of time report"
        },
        "travelAmount": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Travel time in minutes"
        },
        "travelComment": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Comment for travel time"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        [
  {
    "dutyType": 0,
    "amount": 120,
    "start": "2015-09-08T14:06:00.000+0300",
    "project": 3094,
    "billableStatus": 4,
    "overtimeAmount": 60,
    "task": 3124,    
    "billingComment": "requirements workshop preparation",
    "person": 3081,
    "comment": "testing comment",
    "overtimeComment": "urgent bug fix in release",
    "finish": "2015-09-08T16:06:00.000+0300",
    "id": 4138,
    "travelComment": "visit to customer permises for new installation",
    "travelAmount": 180,
    "status": 0
  },
    {
    "dutyType": 2040,
    "amount": 180,
    "start": "2015-09-08T14:06:00.000+0300",
    "project": 4136,
    "billableStatus": 1,
    "overtimeAmount": 0,
    "task": 3124,    
    "billingComment": null,
    "person": 3081,
    "comment": "",
    "overtimeComment": "",
    "finish": "2015-09-08T16:06:00.000+0300",
    "id": 4156,
    "travelComment": "",
    "travelAmount": 0,
    "status": 0
  }
]

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"

  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:
