  "googleTalk": "gtalk_id",
  "shippingDepartment": "First Department",
  "account": 51
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 204

                                                                        No HTTP body returned

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        delete /users/{id}

                                                                        Remove a user from PlanMill

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        URI Parameters

                                                                        • id: required (string)

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR

                                                                        HTTP status code 204

                                                                        No HTTP body returned

                                                                        HTTP status code 400

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 401

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 403

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 404

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                        HTTP status code 429

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        HTTP status code 500

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                        Body

                                                                        Type: application/json

                                                                        Example:

                                                                        {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                        /users/{id}/attachments get

                                                                        Collection of available attachments in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

                                                                        get

                                                                        Get a list of attachments

                                                                        get /users/{id}/attachments

                                                                        Get a list of attachments

                                                                        Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                        PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                        • Request
                                                                        • Response

                                                                        URI Parameters

                                                                        • id: required (string)

                                                                        Headers

                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                          See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                          nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                          timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                          signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                        • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                          Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          EUR

                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          [
  {
    "size": 56,
    "createdBy": 2848153,
    "created": "2015-09-02T16:45:25.877+0300",
    "name": "attached_file.txt",
    "modified": "2015-09-02T16:45:23.353+0300",
    "id": 2848174
  },
  {
    "size": 56,
    "createdBy": 2848153,
    "created": "2015-09-02T16:45:25.877+0300",
    "name": "attached_file_delete.txt",
    "modified": "2015-09-02T16:45:23.353+0300",
    "id": 2848175
  }
]

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 404

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 429

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          HTTP status code 500

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/attachments/{id} put get delete

                                                                          put
                                                                          get

                                                                          View details of single attachment

                                                                          delete

                                                                          Remove a attachment from PlanMill

                                                                          put /users/{id}/attachments/{id}

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)
                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR
                                                                          • Content-Type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            application/json;charset=UTF-8

                                                                          HTTP status code 204

                                                                          No HTTP body returned

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"

  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"

  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"

                                                                          get /users/{id}/attachments/{id}

                                                                          View details of single attachment

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)
                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          Contents of file

                                                                          delete /users/{id}/attachments/{id}

                                                                          Remove a attachment from PlanMill

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)
                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          HTTP status code 204

                                                                          No HTTP body returned

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/meta get

                                                                          Get meta information for the updatable fields of the user.

                                                                          get

                                                                          View details of single meta

                                                                          get /users/{id}/meta

                                                                          View details of single meta

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 404

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 429

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          HTTP status code 500

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/capacity get

                                                                          Collection of available capacities in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

                                                                          get

                                                                          Get a list of capacity

                                                                          get /users/{id}/capacity

                                                                          Get a list of capacity

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          Query Parameters

                                                                          • start: required (string)

                                                                            Start date of the capacity calendar in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
                                                                          • finish: required (string)

                                                                            Finish date of the capacity calendar in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Schema:

                                                                          {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all capacity calendar entities",
  "type": "array",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "date": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
    },
    "amount": {
      "type": "number",
      "description": "Working hours capacity showed in minutes of this day"
    },
    "description": {
      "type": [ "string", "null" ],
      "description": "Description of the day if it is a holiday"
    }
  }
}

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          [
  {
    "date": "2014-12-23T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "amount": 450,
    "description": null
  },
  {
    "date": "2014-12-24T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "amount": 0,
    "description": "Christmas Eve - Jouluaatto"
  },
  {
    "date": "2014-12-25T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "amount": 0,
    "description": "Christmas Day - Joulupäivä"
  },
  {
    "date": "2014-12-26T00:00:00.000+0200",
    "amount": 0,
    "description": "2.Christmas Day, Boxing Day - 2.joulupäivä, Tapaninpäivä",
  }
]

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 404

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 429

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          HTTP status code 500

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/overtimebalance get

                                                                          A single overtimebalance in PlanMill. This is a read-only item

                                                                          get

                                                                          View details of single over time balance

                                                                          get /users/{id}/overtimebalance

                                                                          View details of single over time balance

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          Query Parameters

                                                                          • finish: (string)

                                                                            Start date of the balance in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-12-31T00:00:00.000+0200

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Schema:

                                                                          {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all balance entities",
  "type": "object",
  "required": [ "amount" ],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "amount": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Balance amount in minutes of a user"
    }
  }
}

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "amount": 450
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 404

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 429

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          HTTP status code 500

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/reportableassignment get

                                                                          Collection of available reportableassignments in PlanMill. This is a read-only collection

                                                                          get

                                                                          A single user's reportable assignments in PlanMill. This is a read-only item.

                                                                          get /users/{id}/reportableassignment

                                                                          A single user's reportable assignments in PlanMill. This is a read-only item.

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          Query Parameters

                                                                          • start: (string)

                                                                            Start date of the capacity calendar in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200
                                                                          • finish: (string)

                                                                            Finish date of the capacity calendar in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-01-01T00:00:00.000+0200

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Schema:

                                                                          {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for reportable assignments of a user",
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "$ref": "#/definitions/reportableAssignments"
  },
  "definitions": {
    "reportableAssignments": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "taskBillableStatus": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Billable status of the user's task"
        },
        "taskStart": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
        },
        "assignmentCreated": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
        },
        "task": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "Task of a user"
        },
        "project": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "If task's status is billable, time report's status can be either billable or non-billable"
        },
        "taskName": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of the user's task"
        },
        "lastTimereportCreated": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
        },
        "projectName": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Name of the user's project"
        },
        "taskFinish": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "(\\d{4})-([0][1-9]|[1][0-2])-([0][1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|[3][0-1])T([0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3]):([0-5][0-9]):([0-5][0-9]).(\\d{3})((\\+|\\-)([0-9]|[0][0-9]|[1][0-9]|[2][0-3])([0-5][0-9]))"
        },
        "account": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Account id that the assignment belongs to"
        },
        "accountName": {
          "type": ["string", "null"],
          "description": "Account name that the assignment belongs to"
        },
        "assignment": {
          "type": ["integer", "null"],
          "description": "Assignment id"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          [
  {
    "taskBillableStatus": 2,
    "taskStart": "2015-05-25T10:15:00.000+0300",
    "assignmentCreated": "2015-05-25T10:15:14.580+0300",
    "task": 8139,
    "project": 8137,
    "assignment": 1232,
    "accountName": null,
    "account": 1232,
    "taskName": "Test Task 1",
    "lastTimereportCreated": "1970-01-01T02:00:00.000+0200",
    "projectName": "Test Project A (13024)",
    "taskFinish": "2015-05-25T10:15:00.000+0300"
  },
  {
    "taskBillableStatus": 2,
    "taskStart": "2015-05-25T10:15:00.000+0300",
    "assignmentCreated": "2015-05-25T10:15:14.580+0300",
    "task": 8139,
    "project": 8137,
    "assignment": 1232,
    "accountName": null,
    "account": 1232,
    "taskName": "Test Task 2",
    "lastTimereportCreated": "1970-01-01T02:00:00.000+0200",
    "projectName": "Test Project B (13027)",
    "taskFinish": "2015-05-25T10:15:00.000+0300"
  }
]

                                                                          HTTP status code 400

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "ID in GET request URI was malformed",
  "code": "00003"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 401

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Nonce too old",
  "code": "00401"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 403

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Timer is not allowed to go over 24h! Rounding it down.",
  "code": "00403"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 404

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Item not found",
  "code": "00404"
}

                                                                          HTTP status code 429

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          HTTP status code 500

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • Content-type: required (string - default: application/json;charset=UTF-8 )

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "message": "Invalid date pattern",
  "code": "00500"
}

                                                                          /users/{id}/timebalance get

                                                                          A single timebalance in PlanMill. This is a read-only item

                                                                          get

                                                                          View details of single timebalance

                                                                          get /users/{id}/timebalance

                                                                          View details of single timebalance

                                                                          Secured by oauth_2.0

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters

                                                                            timestamp: time when request was sent (must match API servers time within 60s accuracy), in epoc format

                                                                            signature: hmac-SHA256 encrypted secret, calculated for every request based on base-64 encryption of user's id, timestamp and nonce

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            user:1234567;nonce:8usfNOfr;timestamp:1407834635;signature:1JR2KeTuJGNMdZr+Piys3PXoMnRW9AsTjcAaFo/MF9A=
                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Currency: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 3)

                                                                            Recommended to be given. If currency not given in request header, user's current currency set in user settings is used. ISO code of currency in which money values should be shown or saved. Applies to all money attributes of the object, but may be converted by backend to the object specific currency. Some objects and their attributes may not care about the given currency but use the object's own currency

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            EUR

                                                                          Query Parameters

                                                                          • finish: (string)

                                                                            Start date of the balance in UTC format

                                                                            Example:

                                                                            2014-12-31T00:00:00.000+0200

                                                                          HTTP status code 200

                                                                          Body

                                                                          Type: application/json

                                                                          Schema:

                                                                          {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "description": "base schema for all balance entities",
  "type": "object",
  "required": [ "amount" ],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "amount": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "Balance amount in minutes of a user"
    }
  }
}

                                                                          Example:

                                                                          {
  "amount": 450
}

                                                                          get

                                                                          get /users/{id}/traveltimebalance

                                                                          View details of single traveltimebalance

                                                                          PlanMill supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests. More information about it in the security part of the documentation.

                                                                          • Request
                                                                          • Response

                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                          • id: required (string)

                                                                          Headers

                                                                          • x-PlanMill-Auth: required (string)

                                                                            See section Authentication for examples and changes user: user's PlanMill id number (see "My page")

                                                                            nonce: unique string value for each request sent to same resource for same timestamp (60s tolerance) and same user's id and authkey. Its length should be 4-8 characters
